title: Framer Web Developer
description:
\\*\\*Remote work
 



 \\*\\*Contract only
 



 \\*\\*Global position
 



  





  





**About Us:** 
 We are White Turtle, a premium Revenue Engineering and Growth Strategy partner for $10M–$50M B2B scale\\-ups. We operate on a high\\-end, embedded subscription model.
 



 Our digital presence needs to reflect that: zero clutter, highly strategic and undeniably industry leading.
 



  





**The Mission:** 
 We are looking for an elite Framer Developer \\& UI/UX Designer to transform our current website and build two brand\\-new, high\\-converting landing pages (including our pricing page).
 



 We do not want standard templates. We want fluid, bespoke animations, seamless scroll transitions and a digital experience that feels like a top\\-tier SaaS product.
 



  





**What You Will Do (The Deliverables):** 




  




* **Site Transformation:** 
 Polish and elevate our existing Framer site to align with a new, high\\-end "Dark Mode / Monochrome" brand progression.
* **Build Two New Pages:** 
 Design and develop two completely new landing pages from our wireframes, heavily focused on Conversion Rate Optimization.
* **Bespoke Motion Design:** 
 Implement custom scroll\\-jacking, smooth hover states, and complex transitions (dynamic pricing toggles, sticky elements and interactive component reveals).
* **Responsive Perfection:** 
 Ensure flawless execution across desktop, tablet and mobile, with specific mobile\\-first logic for our pricing cards.



  





**The Ideal Candidate:** 



* **The Framer Master:** 
 You know Framer inside and out \\- components, variants, variables and code overrides.
* **The Motion Expert:** 
 You have a portfolio that proves you can build bespoke animations and micro\\-interactions that feel native and lightweight, not clunky.
* **The CRO Mindset:** 
 You understand how users read a page (F\\-patterns, Z\\-patterns) and how to design for conversion, not just for Dribble.
* **The Communicator:** 
 You can take a strategic wireframe/spec document and translate it into a world\\-class UI without needing your hand held.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Skills in Front\\-End Development and Web Design with a focus on creating visually appealing, responsive interfaces
* Proficiency in Back\\-End Web Development and Programming to ensure functional and efficient server\\-side operations
* Experience in overall Web Development, including both the integration and optimization of web systems
* Familiarity with Framer and other design/development tools is a strong advantage
* Excellent problem\\-solving and communication skills
* Ability to work independently and effectively in remote team settings
* Prior experience with scalable and user\\-focused web projects is desirable

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
**Our Company**




**Creospan is a subsidiary of Creospan Inc., our parent company, headquartered in Chicago, IL. From our humble beginnings in 1999 – with just a handful of employees and a mission to help our clients leverage emerging web technologies to build next\\-generation products – technology has changed dramatically, yet our curiosity has remained constant. Our expertise spans across Telecom, Technology, Manufacturing, Ecommerce, Insurance, Banking, Transportation, and Healthcare domains.** 




**To find out more about us, visit our website: www.creospan.com** 




  





**Job Title** 
 : Sr Java Developer Role
 



  





**Experience: 8 to 16 yrs** 




  





**Location:** 
 Kharadi, Pune, MH
 



  





**Employment Type:** 
 Full\\-time
 



  





**\\*\\*\\* NO Freshers and Candidates with 30 days and above Notice Period will not work\\*\\*\\*\\*** 




  





**Required Skills \\& Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 8–16 years of hands\\-on experience in full\\-stack development.
* Strong proficiency in Java 8\\+, Spring Boot, and microservices architecture.
* Experience with frontend technologies: React.js, JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML5, CSS3\\.
* Deep understanding of Azure Cloud components — App Service, AKS, Azure Functions, Key Vault, Event Hub, Service Bus, and Azure SQL.
* Familiarity with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and DevOps CI/CD best practices.
* Experience with Kafka or messaging queues is an added advantage.
* Knowledge of SQL / NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or Cosmos DB).
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills with attention to detail.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

title: Developer Relations
description:
Internset partners with enterprises to connect them with early talent to meet their business objectives. Through Internset's blockchain certification, candidates can demonstrate their expertise in over 800 skills, including programming, 3D design, digital marketing, content creation, video animation, and architecture. This innovative approach helps professionals enhance their credibility and showcase their capabilities. Internset focuses on empowering talent development and connecting it with business innovation globally.
 



  





**Role Description** 




  





 This is a FT\\-remote role for a Developer Relations professional. The Developer Relations Specialist will act as a bridge between the developer community and the company, fostering relationships with developers, providing technical support, and advocating for the use of Internset's platform. Responsibilities include creating and maintaining developer documentation, hosting webinars, speaking at events, and building tools and resources for the developer community. Additionally, the individual will engage with the developer ecosystem, collect feedback, and work cross\\-functionally to enhance the platform's features and usability.
 



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Strong technical communication skills, including technical writing to create documentation and developer resources
* Expertise in programming and software development with proficiency in languages like Python, JavaScript, or similar
* Experience conducting webinars, hosting community events, and providing technical demos
* Familiarity with blockchain technologies, APIs, and developer tools
* Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills to foster relationships within the developer community
* Ability to analyze developer feedback and communicate insights to technical and non\\-technical stakeholders
* Prior experience with developer advocacy or technical community engagement is a plus
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related fields, or equivalent practical experience

title: Comfy Ui (Gen Ai) Specialist/Developer
description:
We are an early\\-stage startup operating at the intersection of generative AI, digital media, and publishing. This role offers significant entrepreneurial and creative freedom within a fast\\-moving environment. You will have the opportunity to apply your existing technical expertise while developing highly relevant skills in a rapidly emerging sector where virtual influencers and AI\\-generated personas are increasingly reshaping digital media.
 



  





 We are looking for an experienced ComfyUI specialist to design and operate a scalable generation pipeline capable of producing several hundred consistent character images per day across multiple distinct characters, as well as short video clips.
 



  





 This is a technical production role, not a prompt\\-engineering position. The ideal candidate can design modular, reusable ComfyUI workflows, implement batch automation, manage LoRAs and seeds for character consistency, and optimize GPU/VRAM performance for high\\-throughput output.
 



  





 Required expertise:
 



  




* Advanced ComfyUI workflow architecture
* LoRA training and integration
* ControlNet, IPAdapter, embeddings, checkpoint management
* Automation logic (CSV/JSON\\-driven prompts, structured outputs)
* GPU optimization and remote server environments (SSH, hosted GPUs)



  





 Experience with AnimateDiff or Stable Video Diffusion and maintaining identity consistency across frames is strongly preferred.
 



  





 You must be comfortable working with unrestricted Stable Diffusion checkpoints.
 



  





 This is ongoing work with long\\-term potential.
 



  





 To apply, please share:
 



  




* Portfolio demonstrating consistent multi\\-character outputs (image \\+ video if available)
* Brief overview of your ComfyUI setup and hardware/cloud environment
* Your rate and availability



  





 Only candidates with demonstrable production\\-level experience will be considered.

title: Staff Software Engineer - Systems
description:
As a
 **Staff Systems Engineer** 
 , you will be a key technical leader in the transformation of the TurboTax platform. Your primary mission will be to design, implement, and drive the adoption of modern, scalable, and resilient systems architectures. This role is central to our effort to decouple the current
 **monolithic** 
 application into a suite of independently deployable
 **microservices** 
 and to significantly upgrade the core
 **Tax Engine** 
 . You will bridge the gap between development and operations, ensuring our modern systems are not only robust and performant but also highly available, observable, and cost\\-efficient in a cloud\\-native environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 The Staff Systems Engineer will be responsible for the following key areas:
   

  

****Architectural Leadership \\& Design****
* Design and architect the migration from the existing monolith to a high\\-scale, distributed microservices architecture.
* Lead the planning and implementation of the Tax Engine modernization effort, focusing on performance, scalability, and modularity.
* Define and enforce system\\-level standards for latency, throughput, reliability, and security across all new services.
* Evaluate, select, and champion appropriate cloud\\-native technologies (e.g., Kubernetes, serverless, modern messaging systems) to support the new architecture.


****Implementation \\& Engineering****
* Write, review, and maintain high\\-quality, high\\-performance, and resilient infrastructure\\-as\\-code (IaC) and system configuration code.
* Develop CI/CD pipelines that facilitate rapid, reliable, and automated deployment and rollback of microservices.
* Implement and manage observability tools (monitoring, logging, tracing) to provide deep insights into the health and performance of the distributed system.


****Reliability \\& Operations****
* Establish and track Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and Service Level Indicators (SLIs) for critical TurboTax services.
* Lead efforts to improve system reliability and stability, focusing on incident reduction through root cause analysis and proactive engineering solutions.
* Drive performance tuning and capacity planning for the modern architecture, ensuring optimal resource utilization and cost efficiency.


****Mentorship \\& Collaboration****
* Act as a subject matter expert (SME), providing technical guidance and mentoring to engineering teams on distributed systems design, best practices, and SRE principles.
* Collaborate cross\\-functionally with product managers, security teams, and engineering leaders to align system strategy with business goals.


**Qualifications**
****Basic Qualifications****
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 8\\+ years of progressive experience in software engineering, infrastructure engineering, or site reliability engineering (SRE).
* Deep expertise in cloud computing platforms (AWS), including hands\\-on experience with core networking, compute, and data services.
* Proven track record of designing and implementing large\\-scale distributed systems, including successful experience breaking down monolithic applications into microservices.


****Preferred Qualifications****
* Extensive experience with containerization and orchestration technologies, specifically Kubernetes (e.g., EKS, GKE).
* Strong proficiency in a major programming language (e.g., Go, Java, Python) with a focus on writing systems\\-level or high\\-performance code.
* Solid understanding of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL) and data migration strategies in a modernized architecture.
* Experience with infrastructure\\-as\\-code tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
* Familiarity with the challenges and solutions in the FinTech or high\\-compliance regulated domains.


 Intuit provides a competitive compensation package with a strong pay for performance rewards approach. This position will be eligible for a cash bonus, equity rewards and benefits, in accordance with our applicable plans and programs (see more about our compensation and benefits at ). Pay offered is based on factors such as job\\-related knowledge, skills, experience, and work location. To drive ongoing fair pay for employees, Intuit conducts regular comparisons across categories of ethnicity and gender.

title: Senior QA
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com
   

  

**Role**
 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP \\& WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**Who We Are Looking For**
**Job Title:** 
 QA Lead
   

  

**Summary**
 We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced
 **Senior QA Engineer** 
 to champion the quality and integrity of our next\\-generation media data lake on Microsoft Azure. You will be a hands\\-on team leader, responsible for designing and implementing a comprehensive data quality strategy from ingestion to consumption. You will ensure that the delivery of high\\-quality, reliable, and scalable solutions.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Data Quality Strategy \\& Planning: Develop and implement comprehensive QA strategies, test plans, and test cases specifically for data pipelines, data models, and data warehousing solutions on Azure.
* Azure Data Platform Expertise: Leverage your deep understanding of the Azure data ecosystem (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Lake Storage) to design and execute effective data validation and testing strategies across the Medallion Architecture (Bronze, Silver, and Gold layers).
* Test Automation for Data: Drive the development and maintenance of automated testing frameworks for data. This includes writing SQL\\-based validation rules, Python/PySpark scripts for data profiling, and leveraging frameworks like Great Expectations or dbt test to ensure data quality at scale.
* Test Execution \\& Analysis: Oversee and execute testing of ETL/ELT pipelines. Analyze results to identify data quality issues, data integrity failures, and transformation logic errors. Document and track data defects to resolution.
* Collaboration: Work closely with Data Engineers, Data Architects, and Product Managers to embed a "quality\\-first" mindset throughout the data development lifecycle.
* Performance \\& Scale Testing: Design and execute tests to validate the performance and scalability of data pipelines. Ensure they meet SLAs for data volume, processing time, and query performance.
* Data Governance \\& Security Testing: Partner with the architecture team to implement and test data governance policies. Validate the implementation of security controls, including access controls (RBAC), data masking, and PII handling.
* Continuous Improvement: Champion and implement robust data quality assurance processes and master data management principles. Identify opportunities to improve data quality frameworks and enhance efficiency.
* Reporting: Provide regular reports on data quality metrics, pipeline success rates, defect leakage, and overall data platform health.


**Qualifications**
* Experience: 5\\+ years of experience in quality assurance, with at least 2\\+ years in a lead or senior role within a data\\-centric environment (Data Engineering, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence).
* Azure Expertise: Proven, hands\\-on experience testing data platforms and pipelines on Microsoft Azure. Deep understanding of services like Azure Data Factory, Spark , Synapse, and ADLS Gen2\\.
* Technical Skills:
+ Expert\\-level proficiency in SQL for complex data querying, profiling, and validation.
+ Strong proficiency in Scala for writing data quality tests and automation scripts.
+ Deep understanding of data warehousing concepts, ETL/ELT processes, and data modeling (star schema, dimensional modeling).
+ Experience with CI/CD pipelines for data (e.g., Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions).

* Leadership Skills: Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Ability to mentor engineers on testing best practices.
* Problem\\-Solving: Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills with the ability to triage and diagnose complex data integrity issues.
* Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field.


**Bonus Points**
* Azure certifications (e.g., Azure DevOps Engineer Expert, Azure Solutions Architect Expert).
* Practical experience testing within a Medallion data lake architecture.
* Experience with security testing tools (e.g., OWASP ZAP, Burp Suite).
* Experience with Agile development methodologies.


**Life At WPP Media \\& Benefits**
 Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and we’re just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media \\& WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the cutting edge of marketing and advertising. We have a variety of employee resource groups and host frequent in\\-office events showcasing team wins, sharing thought leadership, and celebrating holidays and milestone events. Our benefits include competitive medical, group retirement plans, vision, and dental insurance, significant paid time off, preferential partner discounts, and employee mental health awareness days.
   

  

 WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.
   

  

 We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.
   

  

 Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.
